article.class: et_pb_post post-229308 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-elementary-news category-general category-high-school-news category-parents

p.span: Dear EPS Families,
Ellendale Public Schools will remain closed to students due to COVID-19 until further notice.
Distance learning plans are in place to allow students to continue their education while school-buildings are closed.
Below are several important updates for the week of April 20th – April 24th.
Ellendale Public School will remain closed through April 30th

. This closure aligns with the President’s Coronavirus Guidelines for American, known as “30 Days to Slow the Spread.” Ellendale Public School we re-evaluate the school closure at the end of the month. One thing we know is that a safe restart is contingent on continuing positive trends and avoiding a spike in COVID-19 cases.

While we do not know for sure, it is unlikely that Ellendale School will be able to have a graduation ceremony as normal. Ellendale Public School is examining all of the options and will make an announcement regarding graduation in the coming weeks.
As a point of clarification, the school closure includes the playground equipment. Closing school playground equipment aligns with
. Using playgrounds might lead to the spread of COVID-19 because:
They are often crowded and could easily exceed recommended guidance for gatherings.
It can be challenging to keep surfaces clean and disinfected.
The virus can spread when young children touch contaminated equipment and then touch their hands to their eyes, nose or mouth.
Thank you for your support and efforts as we work together to get past the COVID-19 pandemic.
Sincerely,
Michael Kaiser, Superintendent
Ellendale Public School
Dear EPS Families,
Ellendale Public Schools will remain closed due to COVID-19 until further notice. Below are several important updates for the week of April 13th – April 17th.

In order to provide resources to families, Ellendale Public School has created a community resource guide. The resource guide is a collection of resources and phone numbers for services available to residents in our area. The resource guide is not an exhaustive list of all area providers. It is simply meant as a guide or starting point for individuals and families in need of support during this challenging time. The Community Resource Guide can be found below and in the all forms folder on the school website.
The North Dakota Department of Public Instruction (NDDPI) has created a COVID-19 Updates and Guidance website at

The North Dakota High School Activities Association (NDHSAA) has extended the indefinite suspension of Spring Sports in accordance with Governor Burgum’s Executive Order 2020-10 requiring the closure of all public and non-public K-12 school facilities indefinitely, as well as Federal social distancing guidelines. Winter Basketball State Tournaments and Fine Arts contests also remain suspended indefinitely. The NDHSAA will re-evaluate on May 1, 2020 the resumption of Spring Sports, Winter Basketball State Tournaments, and Fine Arts Contests to be considered only if a return to in-person K-12 instruction is imminent.
Thank you for your support and efforts as we work together to get past the COVID-19 pandemic.
Sincerely,
Michael Kaiser, Superintendent
Ellendale Public School

tr.td: Find and report MDS number on label when calling.

504 2nd Ave North, Ellendale, ND
Open the 2nd and 4th Saturday from 10:00 -12:00
South Country Human Service Zone (Social Services)
205 15th Street North, Ellendale, ND / PO Box 279

td.a: Lutheran Social Services of North Dakota. Has a location in Jamestown and telehealth services are available. https://www.lssnd.org/aboundcounseling

tr.td: 814 13th St NE, Jamestown (Comm. Svc) 311 1st Ave, Suite 11, Jamestown (Early Int)

td.a: Community based services and early intervention services. h ttps://annecarlsen.org/

tr.td: Provides inpatient mental health care to individuals experiencing acute psychological distress and requires assessment and short term inpatient care.
404 S. Lincoln St, Suite 11, Aberdeen, SD

td.a: Professional mental health counseling and assessment. h ttp://www.breakthroughpsychservices.com/

tr.td: Serves the counties of Eddy, Foster, Stutsman, Barnes, LaMoure, and Dickey.

td.a: Provides a variety of interventions and services. http://www.dakotacounselinggroup.com/
Mental health services to individuals ages 10 and up. h ttp://www.footstepscounselingaberdeensd.com/
Provides a variety of services to Jamestown and the surrounding area. https://hartcounseling.org/

tr.td: Serves Edgeley, Ellendale, Kulm, LaMoure, L-M, Medina, and Montpelier schools.

td.a:
Behavioral health services in Aberdeen.
h ttps://www.lsssd.org/what-we-do/family-services/behavioral-health-services/
Provides multiple treatment options. A service provider sees kids at Ellendale School one day a week. https://nemhc.org/
Therapists specialize in many areas of behavioral health services. https://northernplainspsych.com/
Offering both mental health and substance abuse treatment. ADHD testing. h ttp://stthomascounseling.com/
Serves core population in Stutsman, Barnes, LaMoure, Dickey, Logan, and McIntosh. h ttps://www.nd.gov/dhs/locations/regionalhsc/southcentral/index.html

tr.td: 2701 12th Ave. S, Fargo, ND 1201 25th St. S, Fargo, ND
The Village has 6 offices in ND and they provide services through the internet, phone and affiliate providers. EPS employees have access to an Employee Assistance Program through the Village.

td.a: Faith based counseling center with a location in Jamestown. h ttps://valleychristiancounselingcenter.com/

changes. Last updated 4.14.2020.

p.span: Dear EPS Families,
Ellendale Public Schools will remain closed due to COVID-19 until further notice. Below are several important updates for the week of April 6th – April 10th:
Ellendale Public School’s approved
can be found on the school
. EPS will continue to utilize distance learning to educate our students for the duration of the school closure.

We understand this change in learning has already brought and will continue to bring challenges. The EPS staff is ready to work with you as our partners in education as we navigate this new learning style. Thank you for working with us in this endeavor.
Parents and trusted adults play an important role in helping children make sense of the COVID-19 pandemic. Check out
for lots of great resources for parents and caregivers. Some of the new resources available include
and
Online classes will not be in session on April 10th as it is a Holiday. Online classes will resume on April 13th as it is a Storm-Make Up Day.
The Grab-and-Go meals signup for next week is due Monday, March 6th at 9:00 AM. Click
to signup. There will be no Grab-and-Go meals distributed on Friday, April 10th. Instead, meals for Friday will be included in your Thursday pickup.

Prom is postponed indefinitely due to CDC social distancing guidelines. At this point in time, a new date has not been selected. We will update students and families as more information becomes available.
Thank you for your support and efforts as we work together to get past the COVID-19 pandemic.
Sincerely,
Michael Kaiser, Superintendent
Ellendale Public School

hr.p: Dear EPS Families,
Ellendale Public Schools will remain closed due to COVID-19 until further notice. Below are several important updates for the week:

li.p: In an executive order, Governor Burgum directed all school districts to develop age-appropriate distance learning plans based on guidance from The Department of Public Instruction. I am pleased to let you know that Superintendent Baesler and Governor Burgum have reviewed and approved Ellendale Public School’s distance learning plan. Approval means that we can continue to provide educational services online during the school closure. Moreover, we will not need to make up time missed as a result of the current school closure. Ellendale’s distance learning plan can be found on the school website.
During the school closure, office hours are Monday – Friday 9 AM – 1 PM.
In order to support technology needs during the school closure, the Technology Office is open Monday – Thursday 9 AM – 1 PM and by other times by appointment.

You can now check out books from the EPS Library. To get a book, fill out the book request form on the school website by 9 am for same-day drop off. If after 9 am, books will be available the next day (Monday-Friday). Books will be delivered to the same place and time as the Grab-and-Go meals.
Our school counselor is now available to provide virtual school counseling through online platforms. Go to the school website for more information.

Lastly, as per Governor Burgum “schools are closed indefinitely” and only essential personnel are allowed access. Indefinitely means “for an unlimited or unspecified period of time”. We will continue to update the community regarding the school closure as more information becomes available.

p.span: Thank you for your support and efforts as we work together to get past the COVID-19 pandemic.

hr.p: Sincerely,

Michael Kaiser, Superintendent
Ellendale Public School

em.strong: Tips & Tricks For Managing Google Classroom & Emails

hr.p: Dear EPS Families,

North Dakota schools have been given the opportunity to provide distance learning to students during the school closure prompted by COVID-19. An important component of the Ellendale Public School’s distance learning plan is equal access to technology, the internet, and other resources. Therefore, Ellendale Public School will be deploying internet connected devices and other resources to students on Tuesday, March 24th.

Pickup Process-Tuesday, March 24: Our team has designed a pickup process that will allow ALL students and families to pick up devices and other required learning materials. Families are organized by LAST NAME and will have two options for pickup. This process is created for the health and safety of all, so please be prompt in the pickup process. See chart below for your time slot to stop at the school. If you have multiple last names in your family, please choose one time slot. If the listed times do not work, please contact the school office to reschedule. We encourage you to bring a backpack or bag to haul materials and supplies home.

Elementary: Parents must be present to verbally agree to the Acceptable Use Policy (AUP) in order to pick up a school issued device. If you are not in need of a device, you must still come and get other learning materials as issued by your child’s teacher.

High School Devices: May be picked up by students or parents as parents have already agreed to the Acceptable Use Policy (AUP). All devices need a policy update to allow online video conferencing. If your school issued device is at home, you must bring it to the school to be updated.

p.span: Pick Up Locations: Devices will be issued on the North side of the building. Grades K-3 will we be distributed near the north Elementary playground door (door #14). Grades 4-6 will be distributed at the parking lot in between the Elementary and the new gym. Grades 7-12 will be distributed near the north gym entrance (door #8). Deployment will occur outside of the school building as access into the school building is restricted by order of the Governor of North Dakota.

hr.p: Dear EPS Families,

Ellendale Public School’s grab-and-go meal program has been a huge success. On Thursday, March 19th we served 25 breakfasts and 45 lunches. On Friday, March 20th we served 89 breakfasts and 91 lunches. A huge shout out to all the staff members who made this possible. It should also be noted that the grab-and-go meal program is the result of a partnership with the USDA and the North Dakota Department of Public Instruction.
Information about the grab-and-go meal program:

li.p: Free meals are available to all children, including children from other communities and children not enrolled in school (age 1 and older).
Meals are grab-and-go, meaning they are to be consumed off-site.
Pick up will occur once daily (Monday-Friday) with two meals available – lunch and the next day’s breakfast.
Grab-and-go meal pick up times and locations:
Ellendale Public School Door #17 – 11:30 am – 12:30 pm
TBC Ray Ulmer Field House – 11:30 am – 11:40 am
Additional sites may be added depending upon demand.
Food will be provided for the duration of the school closure.

hr.p: To receive FREE MEALS for all children ages 1 – 18:

li.p: Complete this form here, by 9:00 AM Monday for meals for the week. If you need assistance with the form or have questions, contact the office at 701-349-3232.
Please complete the form each week during the closure to ensure accurate meal counts. Meal counts are critical so that everyone gets served.

hr.p: Thank you for your patience and support as we have been getting this new program up and running.
Sincerely,

Michael Kaiser, Superintendent
Ellendale Public School
Dear EPS Families,

Ellendale Public School will remain closed until further notice. This closure was ordered by North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum in response to the Coronavirus pandemic. Gov. Burgum announced the closure in a press conference today, Thursday, March 19, 2020. See the full press conference here.

Ellendale Public School administrators and teachers are currently making plans to transition to online or remote distance learning by or before April 1st, 2020 so that education may resume while the building is closed. More information will be released as it becomes available.

Ellendale Public School is now able to offer free grab-and-go breakfast and lunch to all children ages 1-18 years. Please submit a form by 9:00 am for each day of service for accurate meal counts. Grab-and-go bags will contain lunch and the next day’s breakfast. Click here to sign up for lunch and breakfast tomorrow.
We will continue to follow CDC and North Dakota Department of Health guidelines and recommendations.
Sincerely,

Michael Kaiser, Superintendent
Ellendale Public School
Dear EPS Families,

Starting on Thursday, March 19, Ellendale Public School Lunch Program will provide grab-and-go meals due to the current school closure. Meals will be provided using a pick-up process at certain sites in Ellendale.

Grab-and-go bags will contain lunch and the next day’s breakfast. Students do not need to attend the pickup sites to receive a meal. For example, a child or parent can pick up food for their school-aged siblings or children. Due to current restrictions, meals are not allowed to be consumed on site.

A limited number of meals will be produced as determined by the school closure survey conducted earlier this week. If you didn’t sign up for meals you can still stop by as extra meals will be prepared. Please contact the office if you would like to begin receiving meals regularly.
Grab-and-go meal pick up locations:

Ellendale Public School Door #17 (MPR entrance) – 11:30 am – 12:30 pm
Ray Ulmer Field House @ Trinity Bible College – 11:45 am – 12:00 pm
Westside Trailer Court – 12:05 pm – 12:20 pm
Meals will be available Monday-Friday (except Holiday’s) until school reopens. Food will be charged to lunch accounts at regular lunch prices with free and reduced rates applied as usual.

Due to the need for deep cleaning and sanitizing at Ellendale Public School, the administration is asking students/parents to pick up all personal items from his/her locker and gym locker. Clean up times are as follows:

Thursday, March 19, 2020 from 12:00 pm – 5:00 pm
Friday, March 20, 2020 from 7:00 am – 12:00 pm
If these times do not work for you, please contact the school.
Sincerely,

Michael Kaiser, Superintendent
Ellendale Public School
Ellendale Public School will be closed Monday, March 16th – Friday, March 20th. The closure was ordered by North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum in response to the Coronavirus pandemic.
Gov. Doug Burgum announced the closures in a press conference earlier tonight. See the full press conference here.

Burgum said, “The strategy around the school closing is to reduce the rate of infection to allow us to have a week to plan, not just for how we deliver school services, but for us to plan to make sure that our health care system can take care of those that are most vulnerable.”
More information will be released as it becomes available.
Sincerely,

Michael Kaiser, Superintendent
Ellendale Public School
Dear EPS Families,

In an effort to keep factual and timely communication about Novel Coronavirus (Covid-19), Ellendale Public School will ultimately follow CDC and North Dakota Department of Health (NDDoH) guidelines.
At this time, school and the MOST afterschool program will continue as normal. Based on guidance from the CDC, Governor’s Office, NDDoH, and the ND Department of Public Instruction, it is not appropriate to close school for the following reasons:

● Services, like nutrition and special education, still need to be met
● Online classes are not accessible for all students
● Children might stay with grandparents, or more vulnerable age populations, if schools were to close, if parents need to work
● There is no evidence of community spread in North Dakota
● Though universities and colleges are closing campuses, K-12 does not need to close as children are not identified as a vulnerable age population
● The ND Department of Health will give us guidance if schools need to be closed. If cases are not in a community, school closures are not recommended.

Please see the full press release from the North Dakota Department of Public Instruction for more detailed information. You can also watch a recording of the press conference here.
The North Dakota High School Activities Association (NDHSAA) has postponed indefinitely all fine arts and spring sports seasons, including games and practices until further notice. See the full press release here. As a result, Ellendale School has suspended all activities. We will continue to monitor the situation on a day-by-day basis as the situation evolves constantly. More information will be released as it becomes available.

Sincerely,
Michael Kaiser, Superintendent
Ellendale Public School
